billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO COMMERCE, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND SMALL BUSINESS

title: Provides for local community board input in the liquor authority's decision to license establishments serving alcohol for on-premise consumption
summary: Provides for enhanced municipal or, in New York city, community board input in the liquor authority's decision to license establishments serving alcohol for on-premises consumption; provides for increased notice and more meaningful opportunity to be heard.
currentCommittee: COMMERCE, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND SMALL BUSINESS

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  alcoholic  beverage control law, in relation to
         community board involvement in the licensing of establishments serving
         alcohol for on-premise consumption

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  2-a  of section 64 of the alcoholic beverage
    2  control law, as amended by chapter 213 of the laws of 2010,  is  amended
    3  to read as follows:
    4    2-a. Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, upon receipt
    5  of  an  application for a license under this section, an application for
    6  renewal under section one hundred nine of this chapter, or  an  applica-
    7  tion  for  an  alteration  to a premises licensed for consumption on the
    8  premises under section ninety-nine-d  of  this  chapter,  the  applicant
    9  shall notify the clerk of the village, town or city, as the case may be,
   10  by  certified  mail return receipt requested, overnight delivery service
   11  with proof of mailing, or  personal  service,  wherein  the  prospective
   12  licensed premises is to be located or, in the case of an application for
   13  renewal,  or  alteration  where  it  is  presently located not less than
   14  [thirty] SIXTY days prior to the submission of  its  application  for  a
   15  license  under this section or for a renewal thereof pursuant to section
   16  one hundred nine of this chapter. For  the  purposes  of  the  preceding
   17  sentence  notification need only be given to the clerk of a village when
   18  such premises is to be located within the  boundaries  of  the  village.
   19  SUCH  MUNICIPALITY MAY EXPRESS AN OPINION FOR OR AGAINST THE GRANTING OF
   20  SUCH LICENSE. ANY SUCH OPINION SHALL BE DEEMED PART OF THE  RECORD  UPON
   21  WHICH  THE  LIQUOR  BOARD  MAKES ITS DETERMINATION TO GRANT OR DENY SUCH
   22  LICENSE.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03108-01-1

       S. 121                              2

    1    2-B. In the city of New York, the community board established pursuant
    2  to section twenty-eight hundred of the New York city charter with juris-
    3  diction over the area in which such licensed premises is to  be  located
    4  shall  be  considered  the appropriate public body to which notification
    5  REQUIRED  IN  SUBDIVISION  TWO-A  OF  THIS SECTION shall be given.   THE
    6  LIQUOR AUTHORITY SHALL PROVIDE A LIAISON TO THE LOCAL  COMMUNITY  BOARDS
    7  AND  PROVIDE  SUCH LOCAL COMMUNITY BOARDS WITH WRITTEN NOTICE OF ALL NEW
    8  AND RENEWAL APPLICATIONS  FOR  LICENSES  WITHIN  THE  COMMUNITY  BOARD'S
    9  DISTRICT. NOTICE TO THE COMMUNITY BOARD SHALL MEAN WRITTEN NOTICE MAILED
   10  BY THE AUTHORITY TO SUCH COMMUNITY BOARD AT LEAST THIRTY DAYS IN ADVANCE
   11  OF  ANY HEARING SCHEDULED PURSUANT TO THIS SUBDIVISION. THE LOCAL COMMU-
   12  NITY BOARD SHALL HAVE A MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITY TO BE  HEARD  BEFORE  ANY
   13  LIQUOR  AUTHORITY  HEARING  IS  CALENDARED OR LICENSE ISSUED. MEANINGFUL
   14  OPPORTUNITY SHALL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, THE RIGHT OF COMMUNITY
   15  BOARD REPRESENTATIVES TO ATTEND AND TO TESTIFY  AT  A  LIQUOR  AUTHORITY
   16  HEARING  REGARDING  A  NEW  OR  EXISTING  LICENSE  WITHIN THAT COMMUNITY
   17  BOARD'S DISTRICT. Such [municipality or] community board[, as  the  case
   18  may  be,] may express [an] A WRITTEN opinion for or against the granting
   19  of such license WITHIN SIXTY DAYS OF RECEIPT OF SUCH  HEARING  NOTIFICA-
   20  TION.  THE  COMMUNITY BOARD MAY WAIVE THE THIRTY DAY NOTICE REQUIREMENT.
   21  Any such STIPULATIONS AGREED UPON BY THE APPLICANT AND THE LOCAL  COMMU-
   22  NITY  BOARD  AND ANY SUCH COMMUNITY BOARD'S opinion shall be deemed part
   23  of the record upon which the liquor board  makes  its  determination  to
   24  grant  or deny such license.  SUCH STIPULATIONS SHALL BE ENFORCED BY THE
   25  LIQUOR AUTHORITY. A LIQUOR AUTHORITY DECISION WHICH  IS  CONTRARY  TO  A
   26  COMMUNITY  BOARD'S  OPINION  SHALL  SET FORTH IN WRITING THE REASONS FOR
   27  SUCH DECISION AND A COPY SHALL BE FORWARDED TO SUCH COMMUNITY BOARD.
   28    S 2. Paragraph (f) of subdivision 7 of section  64  of  the  alcoholic
   29  beverage  control law, as amended by chapter 463 of the laws of 2009, is
   30  amended to read as follows:
   31    (f) Notwithstanding the provisions of paragraph (b) of  this  subdivi-
   32  sion,  the  authority may issue a license pursuant to this section for a
   33  premises which shall be within five hundred feet of three or more exist-
   34  ing premises  licensed  and  operating  pursuant  to  this  section  and
   35  sections  sixty-four-a,  sixty-four-b, sixty-four-c, and/or sixty-four-d
   36  of this article if, after consultation with the municipality or communi-
   37  ty board, it determines that granting  such  license  would  be  in  the
   38  public  interest.  Before  it  may issue any such license, the authority
   39  shall conduct a hearing, upon notice to the applicant  and  the  munici-
   40  pality  or  community board[, and shall state and file in its office its
   41  reasons therefor]. Notice to the municipality or community  board  shall
   42  mean  written  notice  mailed  by  the authority to such municipality or
   43  community board at least [fifteen] THIRTY days in advance of any hearing
   44  scheduled pursuant to this paragraph. Upon the request of the authority,
   45  any municipality or community board may waive the [fifteen]  THIRTY  day
   46  notice  requirement.   SUCH MUNICIPALITY OR COMMUNITY BOARD SHALL HAVE A
   47  MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITY TO BE HEARD. MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITY SHALL INCLUDE
   48  THE RIGHT OF COMMUNITY BOARD REPRESENTATIVES TO ATTEND  AND  TESTIFY  AT
   49  ANY PRE-LICENSING HEARING AND THE RIGHT TO FILE WITH THE LIQUOR AUTHORI-
   50  TY  A WRITTEN OPINION FOR OR AGAINST THE GRANTING OF SUCH LICENSE WITHIN
   51  SIXTY DAYS OF RECEIPT OF NOTICE OF A  HEARING.  SUCH  OPINION  SHALL  BE
   52  DEEMED  PART  OF  THE  LIQUOR  AUTHORITY'S  RECORD UPON WHICH THE LIQUOR
   53  AUTHORITY MAKES ITS DETERMINATION. THE LIQUOR AUTHORITY SHALL STATE  AND
   54  FILE  ITS REASONS FOR ITS DETERMINATION IN ITS OFFICE AND FORWARD A COPY
   55  OF SUCH DETERMINATION TO THE MUNICIPALITY OR COMMUNITY BOARD.  No  prem-
   56  ises  having  been  granted  a license pursuant to this section shall be

       S. 121                              3

    1  denied a renewal of such license upon the grounds that such premises are
    2  within five hundred feet of a building or  buildings  wherein  three  or
    3  more  premises  are  licensed and operating pursuant to this section and
    4  sections  sixty-four-a,  sixty-four-b, sixty-four-c, and/or sixty-four-d
    5  of this article.
    6    S 3. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
    7  it shall have become a law; provided, however, that effective immediate-
    8  ly, the addition, amendment and/or repeal  of  any  rule  or  regulation
    9  necessary  for  the implementation of this act on its effective date are
   10  authorized and directed to be made  and  completed  on  or  before  such
   11  effective date.
